adjectives.description: plucked (comparative more plucked, superlative most plucked)

entries.meaning: Having had the feathers, hair, etc. removed by plucking.
(of the strings of an instrument) Played by plucking.
(UK, slang, dated) Having courage and spirit; plucky.
examples: He could scarcely contain his admiration. "What a plucked un!" he muttered; "what a plucked un! No miss," he added, "you needn't fear. Fear, says I? You never feared nothink in your life.  [â€¦]

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of pluck
